109
✱  For the management of any ailment or disease, as much care as 
possible should be initially given at home. 
✱  It is most important not to waste time. Management of an ailment or the symptoms should be started as soon as possible 
at home. 
✱  If the condition does not improve with initial care or gets worse, 
the patient needs the attention of the health worker or doctor. 
✱  When in doubt, it is better to consult the health worker at the earliest. Advice given by the health worker and doctor must be 
followed. It is important to return to the doctor, if called for 
follow up.
✱  Minor bleeds from slight injuries to the skin are generally not dangerous and will stop on their own. However, severe bleeding 
is dangerous and must be controlled. Where the bleeding is 
from the surface, one should apply a pressure pad to control it.
